pull.title: Remove duplicate destination decoding
pull.body:
Follow up of #11117, this patch removes an extra unnecessary destination decoding that was identified while reviewing #11117. It is also the only case where `IsValidDestinationString` is called before `DecodeDestination`.

For reference see [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11117#discussion_r137145517).

events.message: Remove unused GetKeyID and IsScript methods from CBitcoinAddress

events.body:
As per @laanwj suggestion on IRC, added a commit to remove unused methods that caused compile warnings:
```
base58.cpp:308:6: warning: ‘bool {anonymous}::CBitcoinAddress::IsScript() const’ defined but not used [-Wunused-function]
base58.cpp:298:6: warning: ‘bool {anonymous}::CBitcoinAddress::GetKeyID(CKeyID&) const’ defined but not used [-Wunused-function]
```
Also rebased.
Thanks. re-utACK 86e6dd4b6, builds without warnings (except in leveldb, which we can't do anything about here) now.

issue.title: Prepare for non-Base58 addresses
issue.body:
Includes changes from:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11247 - Partial cherry-pick to get IsSpendable
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11117 - Prepare for non-Base58 addresses
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11259 - Remove duplicate destination decoding

This is a prerequisite to supporting cashaddr.

issue.title: Implement Sapling Bech32 address format
issue.body:
Requires pulling in some or all of the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#11117
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11259
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11167
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11372

Note that upstream only used Bech32 for addresses; the same private key format can be used to generate both legacy and SegWit addresses, and they maintained the Base58Check encoding for SegWit private keys. Sapling keys are distinct from Sprout keys (the latter are 252 bits, the former are 256 bits), and so we are using a new address prefix for Sapling keys. Thus we will need to extend their address generalization to cover private keys as well.

Does not affect the wallet code.

issue.title: Bech32 encoding support
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#8578
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11167
  - Only the second and third commits (first is in #3228, fourth depends on #2390, later ones are SegWit-specific).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#12757
  - Only the change to `src/bech32.h`

Part of #3058.

issue.title: Refactor t-address encoding
issue.body:
Includes code cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#11117
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11259
  - Only the second commit (first is for QT code)
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11167
  - Only the first commit (the rest are not part of the t-address encoding refactor).

Part of #3058. Precursor to #3202.

issue.title: Prepare for non-Base58 addresses [Step 3]
issue.body:
Finished the complete removal of the base58 address class from the sources, migrated to the destination wrapper.

Plus includes bitcoin#11117 - last commit - and bitcoin#11259 as an extra.
